intro: Gyrostachys aurantiaca, commonly known as the orange-flowered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its sprawling, low-growing habit. The plant produces small, bright orange flowers that bloom in clusters, adding a vibrant touch to its sandy habitat. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a fine layer of white powder, which helps reduce water loss. Gyrostachys aurantiaca is adapted to survive in hot, dry environments, making it a resilient species in its native range.
